indian.details: Free for 30 days, BUT you MUST have a hotel booking specifically via the 'Discover Qatar' website for the full duration.

activities.title: The Orchard (Indoor Garden) — DOH
activities.description: A huge indoor tropical garden inside the terminal. Perfect if you have no visa or it's late — stretch your legs, grab a drink, chill without leaving airside.
activities.founders_tip: Best ‘no-friction’ option when city stuff is closed or immigration isn’t worth it.

activities.title: DOH Airside Food Court Crawl
activities.description: Late-night friendly: quick meals, coffee, desserts, and snacks inside the terminal. Ideal for short layovers or arrivals after midnight.
activities.founders_tip: If your plan is tight, food + walking beats a landside taxi mission.

activities.title: Al Mourjan Business Lounge (DOH)
activities.description: Big lounge with showers, quiet zones, proper meals, and comfy seating. Great for recovering during overnight layovers.

activities.title: Oryx Airport Hotel (DOH)
activities.description: Transit hotel inside the terminal for real sleep, not sightseeing. Best if you want a bed + shower and you’re prioritising rest over city exploring.
activities.founders_tip: This should only rank high when the query vibes like ‘sleep / rest / nap / shower’.

activities.title: Vitality Wellbeing & Fitness (DOH)
activities.description: Gym + wellbeing facilities connected to the airport hotel area. Solid option if you want a reset (stretch, light workout) without leaving the airport.

activities.title: Souq Waqif
activities.description: The main Doha vibe spot: traditional market streets, spices, souvenirs, shisha cafes, and some of the best local food (grills, sweets, karak). This hits CULTURE + FOOD + shopping in one go. Best in the evening/night.
activities.founders_tip: If you only do ONE city thing in Doha, do this.

activities.title: Doha Corniche Walk + Skyline Photos
activities.description: Scenic waterfront promenade with skyline views. Low-effort sightseeing: short taxi ride, walk, photos, and you’re done. Works even if you’re not trying to commit to a museum.
activities.founders_tip: Perfect ‘safe + simple’ option for medium layovers when you want sights without a big plan.

activities.title: Museum of Islamic Art (MIA)
activities.description: Iconic museum (I.M. Pei design) + very aesthetic sea views. Great for culture + photography. Typically not a late-night option, so plan it earlier.

activities.title: National Museum of Qatar
activities.description: Desert Rose architecture + immersive story of Qatar (great if you want ‘real culture’ not just shopping). Usually closes earlier, so it’s a daytime play.

activities.title: Msheireb Downtown Doha
activities.description: Modern walkable district with clean streets, cafés, architecture, and quick photo spots. Great ‘light sightseeing’ that pairs well with Souq Waqif (nearby).

activities.title: Katara Cultural Village
activities.description: Amphitheatre, mosques, galleries, beachfront vibes, cafés — a good mix of culture + relaxing + photo spots. Works best before late night; still okay in evenings.

activities.title: The Pearl-Qatar (Marina Walk)
activities.description: Upscale marina area for a clean walk, cafés, dessert stops, and nice night photos. More ‘chill sightseeing’ than hardcore culture.
